intro: Peucedanum terebinthaceum f. aciculare, commonly known as the slender cowparsley, is a herbaceous plant characterized by its finely divided, needle-like leaves. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments and is often found in meadows or along stream banks. Its flowers are small and yellowish, arranged in umbels, and it produces slender, elongated fruits. This ferny foliage and delicate appearance make it a distinctive member of its genus.
